job.title: Software Engineer - Core Onboard Software
job.description:
Software Engineer, Onboard Software
Our core onboard software engineers work closely with robotics engineers to develop safe, secure, and performant software solutions used across multiple engineering teams, providing reliable and well-designed libraries for use throughout the system. As an engineer on Motional's middleware team, you will implement and optimize middleware in high-performance, production-grade C++ and work in a complex and growing software ecosystem where new features are being added and evaluated rapidly and cross-functional collaboration is essential.
The Motional Pittsburgh office is located in the new Hazelwood Green development at 4734 Second Avenue, a culmination of the city's goal of restoring an economic driver to the neighborhood in a thoughtful, inclusive, and sustainable way. With views along the Monongahela river, the Pittsburgh office is in the heart of this new state of the art development.
What You'll Be Doing
Collaborating with technical experts throughout the organization to deliver and optimize the software platform used by the autonomous driving stack.
Driving design, implementation, and feature development for IPC and process management.
Designing algorithms and data structures for efficiency and performance.
Finding opportunities to improve code and documentation
Providing technical leadership to the team
What We're Looking For
BS or MS in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent knowledge and work experience.
Experience in C++14 or higher
Knowledge of software engineering principles including requirements gathering, software design, source control management, build processes, code reviews, testing methods.
Experience designing effective and elegant APIs that will be used by engineers spanning multiple teams
Experience with optimization techniques used to develop low latency applications
Familiarity with modern multithreading techniques and ability to reason through possible execution sequences to ensure that your code is thread-safe.
Strong problem-solving skills
Experience supporting and monitoring production software
Ability to operate in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Desire to learn new things and to teach and mentor others
Experience working with Linux
Bonus Points
Experience collaborating with System and Hardware Engineers
Experience writing software for complex, safety-critical systems
Experience with Git and Bazel
Experience in the AV industry
Motional is making driverless vehicles a safe, reliable, and accessible reality.
Our team is commercializing a world-class driverless system. The Motional team is behind some of the industry's largest leaps forward in the last decade, including the first fully-autonomous cross-country drive in the U.S, the launch of the world's first robotaxi pilot, and operation of the world's most-established public robotaxi fleet. Strategically formed by Hyundai Motor Group and Aptiv, Motional is fundamentally changing how people move through their lives.
Headquartered in Boston, Motional has operations in the US and Asia. For more information, visit www.Motional.com and follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.
Motional AD Inc. is an EOE. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. To comply with Federal Law, we participate in E-Verify. All newly-hired employees are queried through this electronic system established by the DHS and the SSA to verify their identity and employment eligibility.
